chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua P. Gierach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall have no contact or communication with victim or her residence;  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia
Shall submit a DNA; must advise any doctor he sees of his addiction issues; shall write letter of apology to victim and Wal-Mart with agent's approval
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges; Must be actively involved in counseling prior to be allowed work release

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to all other sentences previously imposed

Probation Intake Order

Case called along with 14CF141 and 14CM215.  Defendant Joshua P. Gierach in court, in custody with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Exhibit #1 was marked.  Victims Rights are complaint.  The Court reviewed the CPR and PQWOR and heard heard each plea of:
Guilty to Count 1, Burglary, in 14CF205
Guilty to Count 2, OMVWOC in 14CF205
Guilty to Count 1, Felony Poss. of Heroin in 14CF141
Guilty to Count 2, Misd. Bail Jumping in 14CF141
Guilty to Count 2, Misd Bail Jumping in 14CM215 
Following Counts are Dismissed and Read in:
14CF141: Counts 3 & 4
14CM215: Counts 1 & 2
13CF205: Counts 3, 4, & 5  

The Court found his pleas were given FKVI, accepted all the pleas, and found Def guilty of the charges above. The Court found factual basis in the Crim. Compl./Info. Based upon the pleas made above, the Court dismissed and read-in all remaining charges.  The Court heard from State, Defense and Defendan and sentenced the defendant as follows:
S/W
4 yrs p&p as to Counts 1&2 in 14CF205 , as to Counts1&2 in14CF141, and as to Count 2 in 14CM215 
360 days in  DCJ  w/h&t commenc forthwith - as to count 1 only 14CF205
He must be actively involved in counseling prior to be allowed release for huber priv. 
Restitution of $10,982.19 to the victim's insurance company; $59.56 to Wal-Mart
No contact with victim, C.A.H., or her residence at 24 S. State Street in Waupun WI 53963
AODA and follow through, any counseling as directed by his Agent
Absolute Sobriety
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid, legal description
No use or possession of drug paraphernalia
He must advise any doctor he see of his addiction issues 
Costs in each case
Letters of apology to victim C.A.H. and to Wal-Mart with Agent approving them prior to sending
DNA Sample

Defendant Joshua P. Gierach in court, in custody with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
